nodes.description: There are a lot of problems in a relationship because of a partner's attachment style. The secure attachment style is the healthiest of the four attachment styles, according to psychologists. How can you identify it?

thumbnail.alternativeText: How to Identify a Person With a Secure Attachment Style

nodes.title: There is a way to identify a person with a secure attachment style

data.body:
Are you involved with people who are afraid of commitment? Did your partners play mind games and violate your boundaries? Maybe they have become too fixated on you.

 Chances are you have formed a relationship with someone who had an attachment style that was not healthy. You might let their looks, wits, or humor draw you in, but never pay attention to their attachment style, which is crucial to their personality.

 It's like winning the lottery when it comes to finding a partner with a secure attachment style. Some of their characteristics can help you identify them.

## They are masters of the art of empathy

 Have you ever made a big announcement to your partner? There is a person called g. Is it a promotion for them to give you a pat on the back and get you to watch TV again?

They told you you were overreacting after you were devastated by a bad experience.

 The kind of reactions you get when your partner does not empathise. If you have a securely attached partner, they will always listen, understand, and support your thoughts and feelings.

They have mastered the art of empathizing, which is one of the secrets to happy and healthy [relationships](there-are-family-characteristics-that-are-codependency-and-disorderly).

 You have to put yourself in the shoes of another person to feel empathy for them. The ability to imagine someone else's thoughts and feelings is what it is. Empathetic means putting yourself in the other person's place and seeing the world through their eyes, unlike sympathy, which means feeling compassion or pity for another.

## They don't need to do validation

Being with a person who lacks self-esteem and constantly searches for validation can be exhausting.

 They might be too cling to you or violate your boundaries due to their fear of abandonment and not being good enough. They might turn to people outside of your relationship for extra validation and jealousy in your relationship, on the other hand.

A securely attached person is more emotionally calmer and safer than a non securely attached person.

 People who are securely attached have high self-esteem. They don't seek validation from other people or reassurance from their partners because of that.

## Balance is brought to every conversation by them

It can be difficult to identify a person's attachment style during the early stages of a relationship.

Paying attention to the conversations you have with your partner can prove to be very useful.

 They talk about themselves a lot. Are they awkward and stressed, come off as arrogant, or are they confident and relaxed?

 How much information do they reveal about themselves, their past and previous relationships? People with avoidant attachment styles tend to reveal too little, while revealing too much is linked with anxiously attached people.

In the middle, we have securely attached individuals who know how to keep the balance right, and who don't reveal too much or too little.

data.body:
## They created a safe and open space for communication

Poor communication is the most common reason formisunderstandings and hurt feelings.

 It is completely unrealistic for most of us to expect our partners to read our minds, predict our reactions, and anticipate our needs. You can't have a healthy relationship if you don't have constant, clear and open communication.

 Avoidant types tend to create distance from their partners when it comes to attachment styles. Anxious types tend to withdraw from their partners and assume that their needs won't be met because they are afraid to be direct.

The space of open and safe communication for their partners should be created by securely attached people.

## They don't want their past to come up in your relationship

 Everyone has something that is emotional. The former won't invite emotional baggage from their past to haunt your relationship, which is the difference between securely attached people and the rest.

A lot of emotional turmoil is created for people when they rush into a new relationship without checking their baggage at the door.

Jeffrey Bernstein is a psychologist.

 To succeed in a new relationship, both partners must be willing to move on. One day, if this doesn't happen, a new partner will do something similar to an ex, triggering a chain of emotional reactions. The feelings are the same even though this is a new relationship partner.

 A securely attached person will not compare you to your exes and will not project their trauma onto you. You won't have to worry about skeletons in their closet because they won't let their past experiences affect your relationship.

These people are able to maintain a healthy relationship because they have accepted their past mistakes and healed their wounds.

## They don't have unrealistic expectations for their relationship

Although securely attached people are always looking to improve themselves, they don't look for a perfect partner

 They accept you for who you are even if you have flaws. They don't expect you to be strong all the time, but they are happy to support you when you can't.

They don't expect you to always be the one who comes up with solutions for the problems that arise in your relationship, but they are happy to communicate and work with you to fix them.

They know there are no perfect people and no perfect relationships, so they don't have unrealistic relationship expectations.

## The bottom line is what it is

Being in a relationship with a securely attached person allows you to grow, make you feel loved, heard, and understood, and there is no drama, mind games, or toxic relationship patterns.

It isn't meant to be a disaster, but securely attached people make you feel emotionally safe and things are much easier.

The content is accurate and true to the best of the author's knowledge, but is not meant to be a substitute for formal and individualized advice from a qualified professional.
